title: Etnies Visits Apache Nation In Arizona
description:
We were proud to accept the invitation by Douglas Miles Sr., artist, muralist, and owner of Apache Skateboards, to visit the Apache Nation Reservation and skate their new skatepark. The San Carlos Apache Reservation was established in 1871, with the many bands of Apache spanning three counties in eastern Arizona.

Our crew on this trip included etnies skate team manager Aidan Campbell, Gabryel Aguilar (Brazil), Malachi Gray (USA), Taylor Nye (USA), Evan Tancredi (Canada), and Darrius Hutton (USA).
 
While we were on the Apache Nation Reservation, we were hosted by Doug Miles Jr., met up with tribal leaders, and got to taste the infamous Apache burger.
 
Chairman Rambler’s Secretary and Apache Nation Skatepark Committee Member Naelyn Pike shared that she believes both the Apache community and skateboard community have resilience.
 
It is safe to say spending time on the Apache Nation Reservation was a highlight of our trip to the PHX AM.
Darrius Hutton said: “It was honestly an amazing opportunity to be able to experience the culture and get to know all those amazing people! The vibes were great, and I was thankful for the tour around to see the scenery and skate spots!”

title: Skate Tales - Experience Native American Skate Culture With Apache Skateboards (S2E3)
description:
Douglas Miles Junior is one of the scions of a new wave of indigenous skaters fusing their roots in native American culture with the modern movement of skateboarding. 

Born and raised in Arizona´s San Carlos Apache Reservation, he was introduced to skateboarding by his father, the acclaimed fine artist Douglas Miles Sr. 

Doug Sr. had started painting on skateboards as a medium and given the groundswell of interest this created, he founded Apache Skateboards, a brand in which the Apache community could recognise a connection to their own culture within this relatively new form of expression. 

As a marginalised and often overlooked people, Native Americans have proven incredibly resourceful in developing and nurturing new iterations of their ancient culture, and Doug Junior spent his formative skating years touring other indigenous reservations teaching Native American youngsters how they could become drawn into skate culture without losing sight of their own heritage. 

Sometimes, when you can’t find space for your own chapter, you have to re-write the book.

title: Volcom - Freedom Wig
description: An artistic masterpiece presenting the Volcom skate team tearing up all mediums of terrain from around the world. Freedom Wig was Volcom’s first skate film and would set the stage for an incredible journey in the years ahead. Shot entirely in film, the movie is a colorful look into the team’s personalities and different styles of riding. A must see for any skater.

soundtracks.track: Minute Men - Little Man With A Gun In His Hand

title: Transworld - Transmission 7
description: Transworld Video #7. Taking a cue from Cinematographer before it, Transmission 7 chose not to give parts to the skaters themselves, but instead, certain cities. The result was a detailed look at the flourishing skate scenes of Los Angeles, NYC, Portland, Boston, San Francisco, San Diego, and many more.

title: CPH Open 2022
description:
Schedule

Wednesday, June 15th - Welcome to CPH
5pm: Mimersparken - Under The Bridge
Cash for Tricks hosted by Hugo Boserup

Thursday, June 16th - The Black Plaza and The Red Plaza
2pm: Den Sorte Plads - The Black Plaza
Hill bomb to slappy - Cash for Tricks
Checkers, boxing machine, and live music!
6pm: Den Røde Plads - The Red Plaza
Session on World’s Best Quarterpipe
5:45pm: Open Session
Top skaters advance to Contest
6pm: Contest
Jams of 6 skaters, 10 mins each
Prizes awarded for Top 5 Best Overall Performances
Random Partying at Kødbyen

Friday, June 17th - Rune’s Bowl and Prison
12pm: Meet at Central Train Station (under the clock)
Buy a ticket for Zone 6 at the vending machine (40 Kroner)
Take train to Høje Tåstrup
Then make your way to (shopping mall) CITY 2 - Rune’s Bowl (clover bowl)
Hitit Challenge: kinked rail
2pm: Open Session
Top skaters advance to Contest
2:30pm: Contest
Jams of 4 skaters, 8 mins each
Prizes awarded for Top 5 Best Overall Performances
5pm: Vridsløselille Statsfængsel - Prison Session
Open Session as we arrive
Football competition, burgers by Nuge, and more!
8pm: Contest
Jams of 8 skaters, 10 mins each
Prizes awarded for Top 5 Best Overall Performances

Saturday, June 18th - Qualifiers and Finals
1pm: Fælledparken - Open Street Qualifier (begins promptly at 1pm)
If you were not invited to CPH, this is your only opportunity to qualify for CPH Skatepark
1pm: Shinner App Qualifier - 16 and Under Only
Jams of 3 skaters, 3 mins each
Top 3 advance to Semi-Finals
2pm: Open Qualifier
Jams of 3 skaters, 3 mins each
Top 3 advance to Finals
5pm: CPH Skatepark - Invite Only
Semi-Finals
Jams of 3 skaters, 3 mins each
Top 6 Men and top 6 Women advance to Finals
Finals
3, 1 min runs, best counts
Prizes awarded for top 3 Men and top 3 Women
Head to Head Death Races
Best Trick in the Courtyard
Backyard Party!

Sunday, June 19th
CANCELED!!! : La Banchina
